name: Sound Off With Soundtracks! Online Quiz | Other Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which soundtrack did these lyrics come from, "Catch a falling star and put it in your pocket. Never let it fade away"?
questions.explanation:
Never Been Kissed.

	The soundtrack for "Never Been Kissed" was released April 6, 1999, on Capitol records. Some of the other performers on the soundtrack were John Lennon, Yoko Ono, The Beach Boys, and R.E.M. BLOCK performed "Catch A Falling Star" on the CD.

questions.text:
"Is this the real life? Is this just fantasy? Caught in a landslide
No escape from reality." These lyrics came from which soundtrack?
options: The Truth About Cats And Dogs
questions.explanation:
Wayne's World.

	"Bohemian Rhapsody" was performed by Queen on the "Wayne's World" soundtrack. Other performers on the soundtrack were Jimi Hendrix, Eric Clapton, and Alice Cooper. The soundtrack came out February 18, 1992 on Reprise records.

questions.text: Which soundtrack contained a song that had these lyrics in it? "There is something that I see in the way you look at me. There's a smile, there's a truth in your eyes."
questions.explanation:
Shrek.

	Dana Glover performed "It Is You I Have Loved All Along" for the "Shrek" soundtrack. Smashmouth, Leslie Carter, and Self also performed on the CD. The soundtrack came out May 15, 2001 on Dreamworks label.

questions.text: Which soundtrack did LeeAnn Rimes sing this song on, "Time, sometimes the time just slips away, and you're left with yesterday, left with the memories"?
questions.explanation:
Coyote Ugly.

	Lee Ann Rimes performed three songs on the "Coyote Ugly" soundtrack including "Please Remember". Other performers on the soundtrack were Charlie Daniels, INXS, and Don Henley. The soundtrack came out August 1, 2000 on Curb Records.

questions.text: Which soundtrack from a Sandra Bullock movie did these lyrics originate from, "Chances are you'll find me somewhere on your road tonight. Seems I always end up driving by"?
questions.explanation:
Hope Floats.

	"Chances Are" was performed by Bob Seger and Martina McBride. Other performers on the soundtrack were Lyle Lovett, Deanna Carter, and Bryan Adams. The "Hope Floats" soundtrack came out May 19, 1998 on Capitol records.

questions.text: "Every day I get in the queue (Too much, the Magic Bus) To get on the bus that takes me to you. (Too much, the Magic Bus)." These lyrics came from what Ben Affleck movie soundtrack?
questions.explanation:
Forces of Nature.

	"Magic Bus" was on the "Forces of Nature" soundtrack which came out March 16, 1999 on Dreamworks records. It was performed by Swervedriver. Other performers on the soundtrack were U2, Holly Palmer, and Blue Boy.

questions.text: "A man is placed upon the steps, a baby cries, and high above the church bells start to ring." These lyrics came from what soundtrack?
questions.explanation:
Pay It Forward.

	"Calling All Angels" was performed by Jane Siberry and k.d. lang on the "Pay It Forward" soundtrack which came out November 7, 2000 on Varese records. Thomas Newman composed the music for the soundtrack.

questions.text: "You made me love you. I didn't want to do it, I didn't want to do it." These lyrics were from what movie soundtrack?
questions.explanation:
You've Got Mail.

	On December 1, 1998, the "You've Got Mail" soundtrack came out on Atlantic records. Jimmy Durante performed "You Made Me Love You" on the soundtrack which had performers like Carol King, The Cranberries, and Sinead O'Connor.

questions.text: What soundtrack contained these song lyrics, "Shadows grow so long before my eyes, and they're moving across the page"?
options: How To Make An American Quilt
questions.explanation:
Reality Bites.

	"Baby I Love Your Way" was performed on the "Reality Bites" soundtrack which came out February 1, 1994 on RCA records. Performers such as U2, Lenny Kravitz, and The Posies also performed on the soundtrack.

questions.text: These lyrics, "Lying here with you, listening to the rain. Smiling just to see the smile upon your face", came from what soundtrack?
questions.explanation:
Message In A Bottle.

	The "Message In A Bottle" soundtrack came out February 9, 1999 on Atlantic records. Edwin McCain's song "I Could Not Ask For More" was written specifically for the movie. Other performers on the soundtrack were Sarah McLachlin, Laura Pausini, and Marc Cohn.
